intro.text: When we're stuck in 'either/or' thinking, we miss the complexity of real situations. This exercise helps you identify extremes and find the truth that exists in both perspectives.

sections.title: Describe the Situation
sections.instructions: Write about a situation where you feel stuck in 'either/or' thinking. What's the dilemma you're facing?
sections.placeholder1: Example: I must work constantly to succeed OR I'll fail completely...

sections.title: Identify the Extremes
sections.question1: What's one extreme position in this situation?

sections.title: Find Truth in Both Sides
sections.question1: What truth or wisdom exists in the first extreme?
sections.question2: What truth or wisdom exists in the second extreme?

sections.title: Middle Path Perspective
sections.instructions: How can you hold both truths at the same time? What would a balanced, 'both/and' perspective look like?
sections.placeholder1: Example: I can work hard AND take breaks. Success includes both effort and self-care....
